Identification_Information:
Citation:
Citation_Information:
Originator: Sanborn Map Company, Inc
Publication_Date: 20111216
Title: Anne Arundel County 3 Ft DEM Metadata
Geospatial_Data_Presentation_Form: vector digital data
Description:
Abstract: DEM raster for Anne Arundel County.
Purpose:
This LIDAR operation was designed to provide a high density set of masspoints within the defined areas. The data sets are suitable for the development of contours for use in hydraulic/hydrologic model development, and for assessing environmental impacts.Typical uses for the data set include: FEMA Flood Plain Map Modernization. DFIRM map updates. Watersheds and other hydro studies per FEMA specifications. County Mapping projects which include several uses, in addition to Flood mitigation assessment. Mapping projects that include accuracy verification, reporting and meta data.

Users should not use these data for critical applications without a full awareness of its limitations.

Lineage:
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
USGS v13 hydro data (> 1 acre waterbodies, >40' wide rivers) was compiled using stereo intensity images derived from the collected Lidar Data. The Lidar Bare Earth point data and compiled hydro data was ingested into working ESRI geodatabases. Basic Topology checks on Hydro data is undertaken and issues corrected. A Terrain was created from the Hydro data. Processes were run to find hydro points that were non-monotonistic and the fell above the lidar surface. Monotonicity errors, Terrain errors, and Hydro errors were fixed and then re-checked for correctness. A secondary Terrain was produced from the Lidar points AND the final hydro breakline data. Raster DEM files were created from the Terrain. Hillshades were produced from the DEM as a final QC process. Any issues seen in the Hillshades are rectified and any subsequent data reproduced. Upon acceptance of the QC process, the data was readied for Delivery. Metadata files are produced.
Process_Date: 20111216
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
Data is used at part of a proprietary hydro flattening process to meet the USGS v13 specifications.
Process_Date: 20111216
Process_Step:
Process_Description:
Ready data for Delivery. Breaklines & DEM, clipped to DEM_Tile_Layout. Breaklines include Island, Rivers, and Waterbody, 5907 foot by - 3939 foot tile index.
Process_Date: 20111216
